    • Method Detail

      • isSupported

        public boolean isSupported()
        Test to see if this device hardware is OUYA-supported (OUYA console, M.O.J.O., etc).
        Returns:
        true if the device we're on is officially OUYA-supported, false if not.

      • deviceName

        public java.lang.String deviceName()
        The user-visible name for this device.
        Returns:
        the user-visible name for this device.

      • deviceEnum

        public OuyaFacade.DeviceEnum deviceEnum()
        The corresponding device enum value. It is possible for this to be UNKNOWN, and yet isSupported() to return true. This can happen if new hardware support has been added, yet this game has been compiled against an older ODK which doesn't have an enum entry for the new hardware.
        Returns:
        an enum representing the device hardware.
